info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 2:21PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yavapai and Coconino Counties near and just south of Ash Fork through 300 PM MST... At 220 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Ash Fork, or 24 miles north of Chino Valley, moving southwest at 5 to 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, up to penny size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ash Fork. This includes the following highways... Business Interstate 40 near mile marker 146. Interstate 40 between mile markers 140 and 152. State Route 89 between mile markers 341 and 363. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
